result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles D Barrs

records.addlTxt: Bail Jumping is from Waukesha County Case 22CT301

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no further law violations.

11:37 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court as a Friend of the Court.   Defendant Charles D Barrs did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Gutierrez will look into getting appointed in this matter.
Based on defendant's non-appearance Court lifts the stay in this matter.
Court orders cash bail in the amount of $250.00.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:07 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court as a Friend of the Court.   Defendant Charles D Barrs did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is unsure why the defendant did not appear today and has had recent contact with him.
Based on defendant's non-appearance Court orders capias STAYED until the next court date.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Charles D Barrs not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the Defendant has another case set in the Trial Court.
Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
The Court will adjourn.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
